meanings.definition: To make a living or support oneself by labor or toil.
meanings.sent1: She ekes out a living by working at the local bakery.
meanings.sent2: He eked out a living as a street performer before landing a stable job.
meanings.sent3: The little mouse ekes out a living by collecting crumbs from the kitchen floor.
meanings.sent4: In the harsh desert, the cactus ekes out a living by storing water in its thick stem.
meanings.sent5: The determined ant ekes out a living by tirelessly gathering food for the colony.

meanings.definition: To supplement or add to something in a meager, inadequate, or barely sufficient way.
meanings.sent1: She ekes out her savings by taking on extra freelance projects.
meanings.sent2: The student eked out his essay with a few additional quotes to meet the word count.
meanings.sent3: The chef ekes out the flavor of the dish with a pinch of salt.
meanings.sent4: The sunlight ekes out through the thick clouds, casting a faint glow on the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The artist ekes out the details of the painting with delicate brush strokes.
